title.rendered: Website Development Cost in India: Features, Pricing Plans & Different Costs Involved

content.rendered:
So, you have decided to create a website for your company or shop in 2024 But not sure how much should a website cost? Before you dive straight into, “which is the best company for Website Development in India” or “how to hire a website development company, lets learn website development cost from different providers so you can better understand where to invest your budget to build the website.

Website development cost in India can fluctuate within specific ranges. For instance, a basic website might fall between ₹ 50,000 to ₹ 1,00,000 ($600 – $1200), while a small business site could typically range from ₹ 80,000 to ₹ 1,50,000 ($950 – $1800). E-commerce platforms tend to cost between ₹ 1,50,000 to ₹ 4,00,000 ($1800 – $4800), and if you seek a custom-built website with unique functionalities, the expenditure may be higher, averaging between ₹ 2,00,000 to ₹ 6,00,000 ($2400 – $7200).

Website Development Cost in India

Website Creation CostWebsite Package DetailsGet Started Now
INR 10,000 Only5 Pages, Slider, Free Logo, Dynamic Website, Free Domain, Hosting Free for 1st year, Contact Form-1 etcPackage Details
INR 15,000 Only10 Pages, Slider, Free Logo, Dynamic Website, Free Domain, Hosting Free for 1st year, Contact Form-1 etcPackage Details
INR 25,000 OnlyE-Commerce Website Development Costs Up To 50 ProductsPackage Details

Average Website Development Cost in India

The average cost of building a website in India can vary significantly based on factors like complexity, features, and the expertise of developers. Here’s a rough breakdown in both USD and INR:

  • Basic Website: It can cost around ₹ 50,000 to ₹ 1,00,000 ($600 – $1200).
  • Small Business Website: Expect a range of ₹ 80,000 to ₹ 1,50,000 ($950 – $1800).
  • E-commerce Website: The cost might fall between ₹ 1,50,000 to ₹ 4,00,000 ($1800 – $4800).
  • Custom Website with Unique Features: This could range from ₹ 2,00,000 to ₹ 6,00,000 ($2400 – $7200) or more.

These are approximate figures and can vary based on specific requirements, additional functionalities, design intricacies, and the agency or developer’s pricing structure. Always consult with developers to get accurate quotes based on your project needs.

What determines the website development cost in India?

Several factors influence the cost of website development in India:

  1. Complexity and Size: The number of pages, features, and complexity significantly impact costs. Basic websites cost less compared to e-commerce platforms or sites with advanced functionalities.

  2. Design Requirements: Custom design work and intricate design elements increase costs. Pre-made templates are more cost-effective.

  3. Functionality and Features: Additional features like e-commerce, user authentication, databases, integrations with third-party services, etc., contribute to higher costs.

  4. Content Management System (CMS): Using open-source CMS like WordPress or Drupal might be cheaper compared to custom-built content management systems.

  5. Customization and Uniqueness: Uniquely designed or highly customized websites demand more resources and expertise, thus increasing costs.

  6. Development Timeframe: Urgent projects or tight deadlines might incur additional charges for expedited work.

  7. Developer’s Expertise: Experienced agencies or developers tend to charge higher rates due to their expertise and quality of work.

  8. Maintenance and Support: Post-launch maintenance, updates, and technical support are ongoing costs to consider.

  9. Additional Services: SEO optimization, content creation, ongoing support, and hosting services can add to the overall cost.

  10. Location and Market Rates: Rates can vary based on the region within India and the prevailing market rates in that area.

Understanding these factors helps in estimating costs accurately and allows for better planning when seeking website development services in India.

Website Development Cost According to Number of Pages

The cost of website development can vary significantly based on several factors, including the complexity of design, functionality requirements, features, and the expertise of the developer or agency. However, here’s a rough estimate for different sizes of websites in INR:

5-page website development cost: Basic websites typically consist of a home page, about us, services, contact, and maybe a gallery can range from ₹10,000 to ₹50,000 or more depending on customization and features.

10-page website development cost: With additional pages such as product pages, blog sections, or more detailed service pages, costs can range from ₹20,000 to ₹1,00,000 or more, again depending on complexity.

20-page website development cost: Larger websites with more content, possibly including e-commerce functionality or more intricate design elements, may range from ₹50,000 to ₹3,00,000 or beyond.

40-page website development cost: For more extensive websites, potentially with multiple sections, advanced features, databases, or e-commerce capabilities, costs can range from ₹1,00,000 to ₹5,00,000 or higher.

Remember, these are website development estimates, and the actual cost to build a website can vary based on various factors. It’s crucial to communicate your specific requirements to a web developer or agency to get a more accurate website development quote for your project. Factors like custom design, special functionalities, responsive design for mobile devices, content creation, maintenance, and ongoing support can all influence the final cost.

website development Cost based on technology used

The cost of website development can vary based on the technology stack chosen for building the site. Different technologies come with their own advantages, complexities, and associated costs. Here’s a general breakdown based on some common technology choices:

  1. WordPress:

    • Cost: ₹10,000 to ₹1,00,000+ depending on customization.
    • Details: WordPress is popular for its flexibility and ease of use. Basic WordPress sites with pre-designed themes and minimal customization might cost less, while highly customized or complex WordPress websites with plugins and custom themes can be more expensive.

  2. Custom Development (HTML/CSS/JavaScript/PHP):

    • Cost: ₹50,000 to ₹5,00,000+ or more.
    • Details: Custom development involves building a website from scratch using programming languages. Costs can vary widely based on the complexity of design, features, and functionalities required. Custom sites often have higher upfront costs but offer more flexibility and scalability.

  3. E-commerce Platforms (Shopify, WooCommerce, Magento):

    • Cost: ₹25,000 to ₹5,00,000+.
    • Details: Costs vary depending on the platform chosen and the complexity of the e-commerce site. Shopify and WooCommerce (built on WordPress) might have lower initial costs for simpler setups, while Magento, being more robust and customizable, might have higher initial costs.

  4. Frameworks (React, Angular, Vue.js):

    • Cost: ₹50,000 to ₹3,00,000+.
    • Details: Framework-based development offers scalability and efficiency. Costs depend on the complexity of the chosen framework, the design intricacy, and the need for interactive elements.

  5. CMS & Backend Development (Drupal, Joomla):

    • Cost: ₹20,000 to ₹2,00,000+.
    • Details: Development costs can vary based on the complexity of the CMS, the customization required, and the integration of various functionalities.

  6. Mobile Responsive Design:

    • Cost: ₹10,000 to ₹50,000+ extra depending on the website’s complexity.
    • Details: Ensuring the website is optimized for mobile devices may add to the overall cost, especially for intricate designs and functionalities.

These estimates are rough ranges and the actual cost can vary based on factors such as the developer’s expertise, project complexity, design intricacy, additional features, ongoing maintenance, and support requirements. Always consult with developers or agencies to get a precise quote based on your specific needs and technology preferences.

Cost of website development for different type of business industries

The cost of website development for various business industries can vary due to factors like complexity, features, and specific requirements. Here are estimates for different types of business industries:

  1. Small Business / Service-Based:

    • Cost: ₹10,000 to ₹1,00,000+
    • Details: Basic websites for small businesses providing services like consulting, coaching, or local services might fall within this range. Costs vary based on the number of pages, design complexity, and features like contact forms or appointment scheduling.

  2. E-commerce / Retail:

    • Cost: ₹25,000 to ₹5,00,000+
    • Details: The cost depends on the number of products, payment gateway integrations, inventory management, and the complexity of the e-commerce platform. Small online stores might be on the lower end, while larger ones with custom features can be more expensive.

  3. Corporate / Professional Services:

    • Cost: ₹50,000 to ₹5,00,000+
    • Details: Companies offering professional services such as law firms, financial consultants, or marketing agencies might require websites with sophisticated designs, client portals, and CRM integrations, leading to higher costs.

  4. Healthcare / Medical:

    • Cost: ₹50,000 to ₹3,00,000+
    • Details: Healthcare websites might need features like appointment scheduling, patient portals, secure data handling, and possibly integrations with healthcare management systems, impacting the overall cost.

  5. Restaurant / Food Services:

    • Cost: ₹20,000 to ₹2,00,000+
    • Details: Restaurant websites often include menu integration, online ordering, table reservation systems, and sometimes custom features like event calendars or food blogging, influencing the cost.

  6. Real Estate:

    • Cost: ₹50,000 to ₹3,00,000+
    • Details: Real estate websites usually require property listings, search functionalities, map integration, and often CRM or backend integrations for managing properties and client inquiries.

  7. Travel / Hospitality:

    • Cost: ₹50,000 to ₹3,00,000+
    • Details: Travel or hospitality websites might need booking systems, itinerary planners, location-based services, and possibly integrations with third-party services for flights, accommodations, or activities.

These estimates are approximate and can vary based on specific business needs, design complexity, integrations, and functionalities required. Complex features like CRM, ERP, or custom applications will generally increase the overall cost of website development across all industry types. Always discuss your requirements with web developers to get accurate quotes tailored to your business.

A Detailed Overview On how much does Building a website cost in India?

The website cost can vary widely depending on several factors, such as its complexity, design, functionality, and the expertise of the professionals involved. Here are some general cost ranges to give you an idea.

Understanding Website Development Cost in India

Website development pricing models can vary depending on the approach and services offered by web development professionals or agencies.

Here are some common website pricing models:

  1. Fixed Project Price: With a fixed project price model, the web development professional or agency provides you with a flat fee for the entire project based on the agreed-upon scope, requirements, and deliverables. This pricing model is beneficial when the project requirements are well-defined and unlikely to change significantly.

  2. Hourly Rate: Some web developers and agencies charge an hourly rate for their services. They track the time spent on your project and bill you accordingly. Hourly rates can vary based on the developer’s expertise, location, and the complexity of the tasks involved. This pricing model is suitable when project requirements are more flexible or when you require ongoing support and maintenance.

  3. Retainer Model: In a retainer website pricing model, you enter into a long-term agreement with a web development professional or agency. You pay a fixed monthly fee or a set number of hours per month for their services. This model is beneficial if you anticipate the need for regular updates, maintenance, and support after the website is built.

  4. Value-Based Pricing: Some web developers or agencies may offer value-based pricing, where the cost is determined based on the perceived value the website will bring to your business. This model takes into account factors such as the potential impact on revenue, lead generation, or user engagement. Value-based website pricing can be more subjective but can align the cost with the expected return on investment.

It’s important to discuss the pricing model with the web development professionals or agencies you are considering and ensure you have a clear understanding of what is included in the price. Be sure to ask about any additional costs, such as domain registration, web hosting, ongoing maintenance, and future updates.

Comparing quotes from different providers can help you understand the pricing landscape and make an informed decision based on your budget and project requirements.

Why Should You Invest in a Website for Your Business or Profession in 2024?

If you’re running a business, large or small, you need a website. End of story. No ifs, and, or buts about it. Your website is essentially your digital storefront, and in today’s world, it’s more important than ever to have an online presence. Here’s why:

Not convinced that you need a website? let us explain some of the key benefits. A website is one of the most powerful marketing tools you can have. It’s a great way to connect with customers and build a relationship with them.

Plus, it’s an excellent way to showcase your products or services. And, a website is a great platform for providing valuable information to your customers.

Building a website is not an option anymore. Websites are how customers find out about your business and what you have to offer them. If you don’t have a website, you’re losing out on potential customers and revenue.

If you’re still not convinced, here are a few more reasons why you need a website:

  1. A website gives you credibility. In today’s digital world, potential customers are looking for businesses that have an online presence. If you don’t have a website, they may question your credibility as a business.
  2. A website helps you stand out from your competition. If all of your competitors have websites and you don’t, then you’re immediately at a disadvantage.
  3. Website is a great way to collect data about your customers. By tracking how they interact with your site, you can learn a lot about their needs and wants. This information can be invaluable in helping you improve your business.
  4. Website is a great way to stay in touch with your existing customers. You can use your website to send out news and updates, or even just to check in with them from time to time.
  5. it’s a great way to get your name and your brand out there. A well-designed website will help you stand out from the competition and attract new customers.
  6. Your website is a 24/7 marketing tool. It’s working for you even when you’re not. It can help you build trust with potential customers and establish your brand. Your website is the face of your business online, so make sure it represents you well.

Building a Website? Must Ask for these features!

Having a website for your business is essential in today’s digital world. It gives potential customers the opportunity to learn more about what you do, as well as how to contact you. A successful website should have certain features that make it stand out amongst the competition and provide a great user experience. Here are some important features that should be included in every website:

Responsive

This is the most important factor of the web design. Responsiveness is the ability of a website to adapt to different screen sizes and devices. For example, the font size, page layout and images may change depending on the device. A responsive website is the one which makes your website to look better and bigger on mobile, tablets and PCs.

Cost to Make a Responsive Website

Creating a website that is optimized for multiple devices, such as computers, tablets and mobile phones, is known as creating a “responsive” website. In today’s world, it is essential for businesses to have an online presence and having a responsive website can help to ensure potential customers don’t miss out on the opportunity to engage with your company. Depending on the complexity of the project and the resources available, the cost of building a responsive website can vary widely.

SEO Friendly Design & Architecture

Creating an SEO friendly website architecture is essential for success in the digital age. It ensures that your website shows up on search engine results pages (SERPs) when consumers look for relevant key phrases, giving you a better chance to engage potential customers. But how much does it cost to make a website SEO friendly?

Cost To Add SEO Features to any Website

The cost of making a website SEO friendly depends on several factors, such as the size and complexity of the site as well as existing optimization levels. Building an SEO-friendly site from scratch can cost anywhere from 20,000 to 40,000 INR or more depending on these factors and how much work needs to be done. If you already have a website but need help making it more SEO friendly, this could range from 5,000 INR to 15,000 INR or higher depending on how many changes are needed.

Fast Loading Website

This is another most important thing of the web design. A website loading speed determine a lot about its nature. Not limited to this, it is also one of the crucial ranking signals that are regularly assessed by search engine crawlers.

How Much Should it Cost To Speedup a Website?

The speed of a website is an important factor for e-commerce businesses and digital marketers. With technology advancing at a rapid rate, it has become increasingly difficult to keep up with the competition and maintain a good website speed. So, how much should it cost to speed up a website? The cost of speeding up your website depends on how much optimization is required and how many different techniques you need to employ. Factors such as optimizing images and scripts, caching, improving server response time, minifying code, using CDNs (Content Delivery Networks), reducing redirects and enabling compression can all affect the total amount you will need to pay for speedy hosting services. The cost will depend on the size of your site and your individual needs; however, most websites are able to achieve a faster load time with minimal effort.

Https For Security

With all of the options out there when it comes to security, it can be difficult to discern between the good and the bad. One thing you should be aware of when it comes to security, however, is that, HTTPS is better than HTTP. HTTP stands for hypertext transfer protocol, and it is the protocol your browser communicates with in order to access the internet. HTTPS stands for HTTP Secure, and it is the secure version of HTTP as it uses SSL encryption, which is secure and keeps your data safe from prying eyes.

How Much Does it Cost to Add Security Features to a Website?

When it comes to website security, the cost of protection can vary significantly. Whether you are looking for basic SSL protection or more advanced levels of web security, there are a variety of price points available. Knowing how much website security costs is an important part of properly safeguarding your online presence.

SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) certificates are essential for any website that requires login credentials or transmits sensitive data such as credit card information. Basic SSL certificates typically start at around INR 3500 per year and include encryption and authentication services. More complex setups, such as those that require multi-domain validation, may cost up to several hundred dollars annually depending on the provider.

Live Chat

LiveChat is a tool that allows you to communicate directly with your visitors, helping them resolve their issues and making them happy about your service or product. It is a simple yet powerful tool that allows you to promptly solve customer issues, thus improving your website usability and user experience. The only thing you have to do is provide a customer support representative that will be available to answer questions via LiveChat almost 24/7.

Average Livechat Feature Cost: INR 1050-14k. There are some software that offer free chat like Tawk.to.

Cost to Add Live Chat to A Website

Adding live chat to a website can give customers and clients an easy way to get in touch with the business. This can help improve customer experience, increase sales conversions, and offer unique customer service opportunities. However, it’s important for businesses to understand the cost of adding live chat to their website before launching this tool.

The cost of any given live chat software will depend on which company you choose and how many features you need; however, there are some basic costs that are associated with most plans. For instance, businesses will be required to pay a monthly fee for access to the software itself as well as additional fees for extra features such as analytics or integration with other platforms. There may also be setup fees or training fees depending on the complexity of the platform being used.

Average Livechat Feature Cost: INR 1050-14k. There are some software that offer free chat like Tawk.to.

Factors That Affect The Website Development Cost in India

 

Domain

How Much Does Domain Cost In India?

The first step towards the online journey is to book a domain. There are many domains selling agencies like GoDaddy, BlueHost, and Google that could help you in searching and buying the domain name to represent your business online.

You can search on the internet to find domain prices from different domain name providers in India. This is the first factor that affects the website cost. A premium domain may cost you higher.

The domain can be registered every year or one can purchase it for two years. Many professional domain registration companies offer a user-friendly dashboard where they can manage DNS, hosting and database requirement of their website without trouble.

Hosting

How Much Does Website Hosting Cost In India?

Once the domain is registered the next task is to host a website. So that your website can find its place in this huge virtual world. Most of the hosting service provider offers space on the server at an affordable cost.

You can book a server on a monthly or yearly basis. The website hosting charges in India depend on many factors. Some choose VPN hosting plans for a more secured experience, some choose shared hosting plans and some are happy with dedicated hosting plans.

There are many hosting companies offering different prices to host your website so search online to find the best hosting company with better hosting prices and plans.

The client can choose to host according to the website’s requirements and budget. Most of the hosting service providers offer the customer support team, these executives can help the client in choosing the right hosting plan for their website.

This factor also affects the website pricing and better hosting service may cost you a higher price.

Since the web world is open for all, it is crucial to ensure that you provide a safe experience to your web user. Make your website secure with an SSL certificate. While choosing a hosting plan opt for an SSL certificate and make your website safe for your user.

Themes & Plugins

WordPress (In case you select this for your CMS) has emerged as an obvious choice for website development. Though, there are several other platforms as well. But, let’s take the popular platform to simplify the costing method.

WordPress offers free as well as paid themes. The paid themes are easier to customize and they can make richer with plugins. The client can choose the theme and plugins as per budget.

Now, the most website offers live chat support, WordPress makes it easier to install a chat plugin to make the website more user-friendly and interactive.

The majority of the website is based on a CMS platform. This content management system makes it easier to update or change the website content without a hassle. This is the reason the client’s now preferred CMS platforms like WordPress for website development.

Website Maintenance

How Much Does Website Maintenance Cost In India

Once the website is designed and launched the next crucial step is to ensure that the website is functioning properly. Most of the website development service providers offer yearly website maintenance packages at a nominal amount. So you have to keep the small amount allocated for the website maintenance.

Also Read: Website Benefits

Now 70% to 80% of people are using their smartphone and tablet to browse the website. You need a responsive website to connect with mobile users. A responsive website is a bit costly, but they are the need of time. If you hire a professional to design your website then it may cost you a bit more depending on their website design packages. Get FREE Consulting on web design services in India.

Content Writing

How Much Does Website Content Writing Cost In India?

Once the website is ready the next concern is to turn it live and before that, you need content to represent your business or service to the online users. You need content for representing your business and service as well as for marketing and promotion of a website.

Choose a content partner wisely as it is going to impact your online presence in the long run. Your content partner will take care of content, pictures, documents, write-ups, videos and more. It is crucial to invest in quality content as its effects are multi-faceted, it influences your brand image as well.

Consider the cost of the content writing agency while calculating the website development cost & web design pricing.

How to estimate the cost to build a website?

Estimating the cost to build a website involves considering several factors that contribute to the overall development process. While the actual cost will vary depending on your specific requirements and the professionals you hire, here are some key elements to consider when estimating the cost:

  1. Website Purpose and Scope: Clearly define the purpose of your website and its key features. Determine the number of pages, the complexity of functionality (e.g., forms, e-commerce, user accounts), and any special requirements (e.g., integration with third-party systems).

  2. Design and Layout: Consider the level of customization and uniqueness you desire for your website’s design. Custom designs will generally cost more than using pre-designed templates. Decide whether you need a logo, branding, graphics, and other visual elements.

  3. Content Creation: Determine if you will create the website content yourself or require assistance. Content creation includes text, images, videos, and other media elements. If you need help with content development or copywriting, factor in those costs.

  4. Development Approach: Decide whether you’ll use a website builder, a content management system, or opt for custom development. Custom development tends to be more expensive due to the need for coding and technical expertise.

  5. E-commerce Functionality: If you’re planning to build an online store, consider the complexity of your product catalog, payment gateways, inventory management, and shipping integration. E-commerce functionality often requires additional development work and can significantly impact the overall cost.

  6. Website Maintenance and Updates: Think about ongoing website maintenance, updates, and security measures. If you plan to handle these tasks yourself, there may be minimal ongoing costs. However, if you want professional support for maintenance and updates, budget for those expenses.

  7. Professional Services: Determine if you will hire a web development agency, freelance developers, or handle the development yourself. Professional services can range from hourly rates to fixed project fees, depending on the expertise and location of the professionals involved.

To get a more accurate estimate, it’s advisable to reach out to multiple web development professionals or agencies and request detailed quotes based on your specific requirements. They will consider these factors and provide you with a cost breakdown tailored to your project.

Ways to Create a Website

There are several ways to create a website, ranging from simple do-it-yourself options to more complex professional approaches. Here are some popular methods:

  1. Website Builders: Website builders are user-friendly platforms that allow you to create websites without coding knowledge. They provide pre-designed templates and drag-and-drop interfaces to build and customize your site. Popular website builders include Wix, Squarespace, and Weebly.

  2. Content Management Systems (CMS): CMS platforms like WordPress, Joomla, and Drupal provide a flexible and customizable framework for building websites. They offer a range of themes, plugins, and templates to create and manage your site’s content easily.

  3. Custom Development: If you have technical skills or the budget to hire a professional web developer, you can create a custom website tailored to your specific needs. This approach involves coding with languages like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to build the site from scratch.

  4. E-commerce Platforms: If you want to create an online store, you can use specialized e-commerce platforms like Shopify, Magento, or WooCommerce (a WordPress plugin). These platforms provide ready-made solutions for setting up and managing your online shop.

  5. Web Development Agencies: If you have complex requirements or prefer a hands-off approach, you can hire a web development agency or freelance professionals. They will handle all aspects of website creation, including design, development, and maintenance.

When choosing a method, consider your technical skills, budget, time constraints, and the level of customization you require. It’s also essential to think about factors such as hosting, domain registration, and ongoing website maintenance to ensure a successful website launch.

Coding vs CMS used website Development Cost

When it comes to building a website, there are two main options: Coding or using a CMS. Both have their pros and cons, and which one you choose will depend on your needs.

If you’re looking for total control over your website, then the coding is the way to go. You can create a completely custom site that looks exactly the way you want it to. However, coding takes time and effort to learn, so unless you’re already proficient in coding languages like HTML and CSS, it might not be worth your while.

On the other hand, CMS platforms like WordPress are much easier to use, even for complete beginners. You don’t need any coding knowledge to create a professional-looking website with a CMS. However, you’ll be limited in terms of customization options, and your site will look similar to other WordPress sites out there.

How much does it cost to create a website on your own?

It’s no secret that a website can be a powerful tool for businesses. But what many small business owners don’t realize is that you don’t need to spend a lot of money to get a professional-looking website. In fact, you can build a website on your own for less than Rs 7,500.

If you’re willing to put in some time and effort, you can create a website that looks and functions just as well as one that would cost thousands of dollars to have built by a professional. So, how much does it really cost to create a website on your own?

To build a basic website, all you really need is a domain name (which can be purchased for around 750 INR per year) and web hosting (which starts at about 375 INR per month).

Additional Website Features And Cost Involved

Website Development Cost Breakdown Using Addons

Adding additional features to your website can be a great way to improve user experience and drive conversions. However, before you add any new features, it’s important to understand the potential cost implications.

Some common website features that come with a cost include:

  • E-commerce functionality: If you want to sell products or services online, you’ll need to invest in e-commerce functionality. This can range from a simple payment gateway to a full-fledged shopping cart solution.
  • Live chat: Live chat is a great way to provide real-time customer support or sales assistance. However, it requires someone to be available to man the chat during business hours.
  • Customized design: A custom-designed website will usually cost more than a template-based site. But if you want your site to truly stand out from the crowd, it’s worth the investment.
  • Website Theme & Its Cost- A website template will cost you somewhere between 4000 INR to 5000 INR and it will help you to get an idea about your website appearance.
  • Logo Design & Cost- A logo design is also an important part of your website building project and it may cost you somewhere between 2000 INR to 5000 INR but can go higher depending on the agency pricing.
  • SSL Certificate & Cost- Website security is also important if your website has some data collection or payment option. There are many SSL certificate providers and everyone has different pricing but it may cost you between 400 to 600 INR per year.
  • Ecommerce Features Set Up & Costs- If you need more advanced features, like a custom design or integration with third-party software, your costs will go up accordingly. The good news is that there are many ways to save on development costs, so be sure to shop around and get multiple quotes before making a decision. If you want to integrate UPI then it can cost you around 3000 INR- 6000 INR.

Overall, setting up all the eCommerce features on a website would take up to  INR 25,000 to INR 30,000.

cost of Adding Complex functionalities and other integrations in Websites like CRM, ERP, and E-commerce etc.

integrating complex functionalities like CRM (Customer Relationship Management), ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning), and e-commerce into a website can significantly impact the development cost due to their intricate nature and varying requirements. Here’s a breakdown:

CRM Integration: Implementing CRM into a website involves connecting customer data, interactions, and management tools. Costs can vary based on:

CRM Software: Licensing or subscription fees for CRM platforms like Salesforce, HubSpot, or custom CRM solutions.
Customization: Tailoring the CRM to suit specific business needs.
Integration Complexity: Connecting CRM with the website, ensuring data synchronization and user accessibility, which might require custom coding or APIs.
ERP Integration: Integrating an ERP system with a website involves syncing data and operations across various departments such as finance, HR, inventory, and more. Costs depend on:

ERP Software: Licensing fees for popular ERPs like SAP, Oracle, or custom ERP solutions.
Customization: Adapting the ERP to align with the website’s functionalities and requirements.
Integration Complexity: Developing APIs or middleware to connect the website with the ERP, ensuring seamless data flow.
E-commerce Functionality: Developing an e-commerce website involves various elements that impact cost:

Platform: Costs differ based on using platforms like Shopify, WooCommerce (built on WordPress), Magento, or custom e-commerce solutions.
Customization: Tailoring the e-commerce site’s design, features, and user experience to align with the brand and business needs.
Payment Gateways: Integration of payment gateways and security measures.
Inventory Management: Syncing inventory, order management, and tracking systems.
Complex functionalities and integrations generally demand more time, and specialized expertise, and often entail ongoing maintenance and support. The costs can vary significantly based on the complexity of the systems, the level of customization required, the choice of software/platforms, and the expertise of the developers involved.

Website builders are the cheapest way to create your website. They offer simple drag and drop functions so you don’t need higher technical skills to develop your website.

How to Hire a Website Development Company in 2024?

With so many website development agencies available, you might get stumped in the selection of the right one. Hence, to help you select the right website development agency and the best website development package, we have thrown light on essential steps that need to be considered while choosing the agency and assessing website development packages. Check out the steps given below!

Tips to save Cost on website Development

If you’re looking to save money on website costs, here are some tips to consider:

  1. Clearly Define Your Requirements: Before starting the website development process, spend time clearly defining your requirements and goals. This will help you avoid unnecessary features or scope creep that can increase costs.

  2. Research and Compare: Take the time to research and compare different web development professionals or agencies. Request quotes from multiple providers and compare their prices, services, and portfolios. This will help you find the most cost-effective option that meets your needs.

  3. Use Website Builders or CMS Platforms: Consider using website builders or content management systems (CMS) like WordPress, Joomla, or Drupal. These platforms offer pre-designed templates, plugins, and themes that can significantly reduce development costs compared to custom-built websites.

  4. Opt for Template Designs: If you don’t require a completely unique design, consider using pre-designed templates. Many website builders and CMS platforms offer a wide range of templates to choose from, which can save you money on custom design work.

  5. DIY with Website Builders: If you have the time and willingness to learn, you can use website builders to create your website yourself. This eliminates the need for professional web development services, which can be a significant cost saver.

  6. Prioritize Essential Features: Identify the essential features and functionality your website needs. Avoid adding unnecessary bells and whistles that can drive up costs. You can always add more features later as your budget allows.

  7. Prepare Website Content: Provide well-prepared content, including text, images, and videos, to the web developer. This reduces the time they need to spend on content creation or editing, which can save you money.

  8. Consider Ongoing Maintenance: Factor in the cost of ongoing website maintenance when estimating your budget. Some web developers or agencies offer maintenance packages at a discounted rate compared to ad-hoc updates or support requests.

  9. Explore Open-Source Solutions: Open-source platforms and tools often have lower upfront costs as they are freely available. Look for open-source solutions that can meet your website’s requirements and save on licensing fees.

  10. Be Involved and Communicate: Actively participate in the development process, provide feedback promptly, and maintain open communication with your web developer. Clear communication can help avoid misunderstandings, revisions, and additional costs.

Remember, while cost-saving is important, it’s crucial to balance it with the quality and functionality you require. Prioritize finding a reliable and competent web development professional or agency who can deliver a website that meets your needs within your budget.

Frequently Asked Questions About Website Development Cost

When should I create a website?

The answer to this question really depends on your needs and what you hope to accomplish with a website. If you are a business owner, it is important to create a website as soon as possible in order to reach new customers and grow your brand. A website can also be a great way to share information about your products or services with potential and current customers. If you are an individual, a website can be a fun way to showcase your interests or talents to the world. It can also be a great way to connect with friends and family online. Ultimately, the decision of when to create a website is up to you, but there are many benefits to having one regardless of your reasons for creating it.

What type of website should I choose?

There are many types of websites to choose from when creating your own. Your choice will depend on what you want your website to do.

One type of website is a blog. Blogs are good for sharing your thoughts with the world and for building an audience around your ideas. If you want to share your personal life with friends and family, or if you want to start a business, a blog is a good option.

Another type of website is a portfolio site. Portfolio sites are used by artists, designers, and other professionals to showcase their work. If you want to share your creative work with the world, a portfolio site is a good option.

The third type of website is a store. Store websites allow you to sell products or services online. If you want to start an online business, a store website is a great option.

What Questions Should i ask to create a website?
  1. When creating a website, the first step is to come up with a concept or idea for the website. This can be done by brainstorming and making a list of what you want the website to include.
  2. Once you have an idea, the next step is to figure out who your target audience is and what type of website you want to create.
  3. After that, you need to come up with a domain name and design for your site. Be sure to keep your target audience in mind when choosing a domain name and designing your site.
  4.  The next step is to set up your hosting and create your website’s content. This can be done by writing articles, creating pages, and adding images and videos.
Do I need a website maintenance Plan?

Yes, you do need website maintenance. It’s not optional. Just like you have to mow your lawn and trim your hedges, you have to maintain your website or it will go downhill fast.

Think about it: a website is a reflection of your business. It’s the first impression people have of you, and if it’s not updated regularly, or if it’s full of errors, then potential customers will think you don’t care about your business. They’ll think you don’t care about them either.

That’s why website maintenance is so important. It keeps your website looking good and functioning properly. It makes sure that potential customers see the best possible version of your business. And it shows that you care about your customers and your business.

How much does it cost to host a website?

The cost to host a website can vary depending on the size and complexity of the site. Typically, basic hosting costs between INR 350 and INR 700 per month. However, more robust and customized hosting can cost significantly more. For example, a WordPress site hosted on a private server can cost around INR 14k per month.

How long does it take for the website to be built?

There is no definitive answer to this question as it can vary depending on the size and complexity of the website. However, on average, it can take anywhere from 2-6 months for a website to be built from scratch. This timeframe usually includes the time needed for designing the site, coding the pages, and testing it all to make sure it’s working properly. Of course, there are always exceptions to this rule, so it’s always best to consult with a web developer to get an accurate estimate.

How much should a company charge for website development?

When it comes to website charges, how much a company should charge is relative to the project at hand. Typically, there are four main website development cost factors: design, functionality, content and hosting.

The most important aspect of website design is making sure that it looks good and reflects the company’s branding. Good web design will help to engage users and convert them into customers. Functionality is also important as it determines how well the website can meet the needs of its users. Important features include search capabilities, shopping carts and user registration modules. Content is what attracts users to websites in the first place and must be well-written and keyword-rich. Hosting is the service that makes a company’s website visible on the internet. It is important to find a reputable hosting provider that can offer fast loading times, good uptime and customer support.

Who to hire for website development?

When it comes to website development, there are many different factors to consider. One of the most important decisions is who to hire for the project. There are a few key things to look for when making this decision.

First, it is important to find someone who has experience in website development. They should know how to design and build a website that meets your needs and looks great. They should also be familiar with the latest trends and technologies so they can create a website that is up-to-date.

Second, it is important to find someone you can trust. You will be working with this person closely on your website, so you need to feel confident that they will do a good job and meet your expectations. Ask for references from past clients and check out their portfolios to get a better idea of their work.

What CMS should I choose for website development?

Choosing the right CMS for website development is essential to ensure that the website functions properly and meets the needs of the business. There are a number of different CMS options available, so it is important to research which one is best for the project. Some factors to consider include the amount of control needed over the website content, the level of customization required, and how much support is needed from the CMS provider.

Once the decision has been made to use a CMS for website development, there are a number of choices available. WordPress is one of the most popular options and is known for its ease of use and wide range of plugins and themes that can be used to customize the site. Joomla is another popular choice with a large user base and extensive library of extensions. Magento is a more robust option that can be used for larger eCommerce websites.

How much should website renewal cost?

When your business is ready to renew its website, the first question you have to ask is how much this renewal will cost. The price of a website renewal varies depending on the size and type of site, the features and add-ons you choose, and whether you need new design elements or functionality. In general, you can expect to pay anywhere from a few hundred dollars to a few thousand dollars for a website renewal.

There are several factors that will affect the price of your website renewal. The first is the type of site you have. A custom website will cost more to renew than a template-based site because it will require more time and effort on the part of the designer or developer. The number of pages and features on your site will also affect the price; adding new pages or features can add hundreds or even thousands of dollars to the cost of the renewal.

How many pages do I need on the website?

When it comes to web pages, how many is enough? This is a question that many people ask and the answer can depend on a variety of factors. Generally, the more pages your website has, the better it will be for your SEO (search engine optimization) ranking. This is because Google and other search engines like websites that are comprehensive and offer lots of relevant information. However, you don’t want to overwhelm your visitors with too many pages, especially if your website is still in its early stages. You can always add more pages as your website grows.

Another thing to consider when deciding how many pages to include on your website is the type of business you have. If you’re running a brick-and-mortar store, you may not need as many pages as an online-only business.

Can i make a website free?

There are many ways to make a website free. One way is to use a website builder like Wix, which offers a free plan with limited features, or Weebly, which offers a free plan with ads. Another way to make a website for free is to use a content management system (CMS) like WordPress.org, which is free and open source. With WordPress.org, you need to install the software on your own web server or use a web hosting service that offers WordPress hosting.

How much does a website cost per year?

There is no definitive answer to this question as the cost of a website can vary greatly depending on the features and functionality you require, as well as the size and complexity of the project. However, a ballpark estimate for a small business website would be around $1,000 – $2,000 per year. This includes domain name registration and hosting, as well as design and development costs. The cost will also depend on whether you choose to DIY or hire a professional web developer. If you decide to DIY, there are many online resources available that can help you get started. But remember, creating a website that looks good and performs well takes time and effort, so be prepared to invest some elbow grease!

How much do designers charge for a website?

When it comes to how much designers charge for a website, there is no standard rate. Some designers may charge by the hour, while others may charge a flat fee for the entire project. Generally, the more complex and custom the website design is, the higher the cost will be.

Another factor that can affect pricing is how involved the designer will be in the project. If you need someone to just create a basic layout for you, the cost will be lower than if you need someone to help with coding, SEO optimization, and more.

So what should you expect to pay for a website? On average, most people spend between $1,000 and $10,000 on a custom website design. However, this price range can vary greatly depending on your needs and budget.

How much does a one-page/single page/ one pager website cost?

There is no definitive answer to how much a one-page website will cost. It depends on the complexity of the design and the features you want to be included. You could spend anywhere from a few hundred dollars to a few thousand dollars, depending on the size and scope of the project.

One thing to keep in mind is that most one-page websites are static, which means they don’t include features like a blog or e-commerce capabilities. If you need those features, your costs will be higher. Also, if you need help creating or designing your website, that will add to the cost as well.

How many hours does it take to build a website?

It’s a question that many people have – how much time does it take to build a website? The answer, of course, depends on the complexity and size of the website. However, according to estimates from various sources, most people can expect to spend anywhere from 20-40 hours building a website.

That time can be spread out over a few weeks or months, depending on how much time you have available. Of course, if you’re not doing the work yourself, you’ll need to factor in the cost of hiring a web developer. But if you’re willing to put in the time and effort, you can definitely build your own website.

Is building a website hard?

Building a website is hard. It’s not something that you can just do in your spare time. You need to have an understanding of coding, design, and marketing in order to create a website that is effective and looks great. Even if you know how to code and design, you still need to know how to market your website in order to make sure that people will see it. Creating a website is a lot of work, but it can be very rewarding if you’re able to make it successful.

Is creating a website worth it?

There are a few things you need to figure out before you start building your website. First, what is the purpose of your website? Do you want to create a personal website to share your thoughts and ideas with others, or do you want to create a website for your business? Once you know the purpose of your website, you can start thinking about the design and content.

Creating a website can be a lot of work, but it’s definitely worth it if you’re looking to build a successful online presence. You’ll need to choose a web hosting provider and domain name, and then design and build your website. You’ll also need to create content and market your website in order to attract visitors.

If you’re not sure where to start, there are plenty of resources available online that can help you get started.

Why does a small business need a website?

In this day and age, it’s essential for small businesses to have a website. Not only does it give your business an online presence, but it also allows customers to easily find information about your company and contact you. Building a website can seem daunting, but there are plenty of resources available to help you get started.

One of the biggest benefits of having a website is that it gives your business an online presence. In other words, potential customers can find your website and learn more about what you do and what services you offer. A website also allows customers to contact you directly, which can result in more sales opportunities.

Another important benefit of having a website is that it helps customers find information about your company quickly and easily. This is especially important if they’re considering doing business with you.

What are pros and cons of websites?

Websites are an essential part of any business or organization, large or small. They provide a variety of benefits that can help you reach your objectives. However, there are also some drawbacks to using websites.

The advantages of websites include:

  • They can be easily updated with new information.
  • They can be used to provide information about your products or services.
  • They can be used to provide customer support.
  • They can be used to sell products or services online.
  • They can be used to collect data from customers.
  • They are easy to use and can be accessed from anywhere in the world.
  • The disadvantages of websites include:

They can be expensive to create and maintain.

  • They require a certain level of technical expertise to set up and use correctly.
  • They can be vulnerable to attacks by hackers.
Why you shouldn't use a website builder?

There are a lot of website builders on the market today. And for good reason! They’re affordable, easy to use, and can help you create a website in minutes. But there are a few reasons why you shouldn’t use a website builder.

First, most website builders are very limited in terms of design and functionality. You can usually only choose from a few templates, and you won’t be able to add any custom code or features.

Second, website builders often don’t work well with other tools and platforms. If you want to use a third-party plugin or extension, or if you want to host your website on your own server, you may run into compatibility issues.

Third, most website builders are not very SEO-friendly. They don’t include many optimization settings or features, and they may not follow best practices for web design.

Why websites are better than apps?

There are many reasons why websites are better than apps. First and foremost, websites are cheaper to make. A website costs a fraction of what it costs to make an app, which is why there are so many more of them. Additionally, websites work on any device with a web browser, while apps are limited to devices that have been specifically designed to run them. Websites also tend to be more up-to-date, as they can be updated at any time without having to go through an approval process like with apps. Finally, websites are more accessible because they don’t require users to download and install anything.

Is it cheaper to make an app or a website?

When it comes to developing a website or an app, there is no easy answer as to whether it is cheaper to make one or the other. It really depends on the complexity of the project and the specific needs of the client. However, there are some general things to keep in mind when making this decision.

For starters, websites are generally less expensive to create than apps. This is because websites do not require the same level of functionality and complexity as apps do. In most cases, a website can be created using a simple content management system (CMS), while apps usually require custom coding.

Another factor that affects cost is the platform. Apps need to be designed and coded for specific platforms (such as iOS, Android, Windows Phone, etc.), while websites can be viewed on any device with a web browser.

What is the cheapest way to start a website?

There are a few different ways to start a website for cheap. One way is to use a website builder like Wix or Squarespace. These services allow you to create a website for free, but there are some limitations. You can also buy a domain name and hosting for around INR 700 per year. This is the cheapest way to have your own website, and you can use any software you want. Finally, you can use free services like Blogger or WordPress.com, but your website will have ads and you will not own the domain name.

Do you have to pay monthly for a website?

There are a lot of factors to consider when you’re starting your own website. One of the most important decisions you’ll have to make is whether or not to pay a monthly fee for a website builder platform or go with a free option.

There are pros and cons to both choices. With a monthly fee, you typically get more features and support, but it can be expensive if your site doesn’t take off. Free platforms are great for budget-minded entrepreneurs, but they often have fewer features and limited support.

So what’s the best option for you? It depends on your needs and budget. If you need a lot of features and support, then paying for a monthly website builder platform is the way to go. But if you’re on a tight budget, then using a free platform may be more appropriate for your needs.
